Description: A collection of sixty-five small 'Ancillaria' shells, slightly filed at both ends, and four small 'Nerita' shells.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Mostagedda, Grave 2221 From the undistrubed burial of a child
Curator's comments: Also from this burial: beads (1929,1015.237 & 1929,1015.238 & 1929,1015.240). Bibliography: G. Brunton, ‘Mostagedda and the Tasian Culture’ (London, 1937), 40; pl.XXII, 45; Grave register, pl.IX.
Bibliographic references: Andrews 1981 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities. Jewellery I (71)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2006-present, Glasgow, Kelvingrove Art Gallery and Museum, LT Loan Ancient Egypt British Museum Partnership Gallery
